TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void ColumnReorderedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, ColumnReorderedEventArgs ^ e);
public delegate void ColumnReorderedEventHandler(object sender, ColumnReorderedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed ColumnReorderedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub ColumnReorderedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As ColumnReorderedEventArgs)
type ColumnReorderedEventHandler = delegate of obj * ColumnReorderedEventArgs -> unit
public delegate void ColumnReorderedEventHandler(object? sender, ColumnReorderedEventArgs e);

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of the control.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ColumnReorderedEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](/dotnet/standard/events/).
